Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse, the interior is slightly grooved and covered with a cream-coloured deposit, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and very faint traces of at least six (?) lines of Coptic text written in black ink survive.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393238) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393238)
